result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo M. Tagliavia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 89 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  Court waives DNA sample.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if Agent deems appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Any drug property seized is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding agency.
Court will allow the cell phones seized to be returned to the defendant.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 3 MONTHS - To be served with non working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  Commencing forthwith.
LAST 6 MONTHS - STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: February 25, 2016 Sentencing hearing filed by Linda Coleman, court reporter.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angelo M. Tagliavia in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
89 Days Credit - If Revoked.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if agent deems appropriate.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (Court Waives Sample ONLY) and Surcharge:  $250.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Any drug property seized is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding agency.
Court will allow the cell phones seized to be returned to the defendant.


CONDITION TIME:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
3 Months to be served - Forthwith.
Defendant remanded to the Custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Last 6 Months - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
